summary: Marissa Cortez Wilson (Jessica Alba) is a retired spy who keeps that identity hidden from her clueless husband and whip-smart twin stepchildren, Rebecca (Rowan Blanchard) and Cecil (Mason Cook). However, when a villain called Timekeeper (Jeremy Piven) threatens to conquer the world, Marissa springs back into action as head of the OSS, home of the now-defunct Spy Kids Division. With help from some cool gadgets and two former spy kids, Rebecca and Cecil join the fight to save Earth.

reviews.content: with to much time, theres always too much time puns and tick tock sounding like hes on helium. they didn't need to make his voice so high. theres all the time in the world and none of it was to make this movie
some of the movie was fun and entertaining, but it seems like the once great spy kids franchise has finally crumbled.

This is no joke one of the worst movies i have ever seen. The effects are awful, the characters are all awful, the jokes are terrible, the story is predictable, the acting is annoying, the plot twist is terrible, and the time puns are both everywhere and irritating. This has to be one of if not the worst movie that came from the weinstein company. Oh yeah and this movie is kinda uncomfortable with THAT elephant in the room.

If zero stars was an option, this film would take the score. "Spy Kids: All the Time in the World in 4d" does the impossible by somehow being worse than the previous installments. The CGI is atrocious, the story abysmal, and the characters more annoying than entertaining to watch. Basically, just everything about this film is just straight up bad, with absolutely zero redeeming factors and is just a film that is so bad it becomes unbearable to watch throughout. Overall, just a terrible film that I would not recommend.

Es una película buena, Aunque los personajes pareciera que estuviesen de relleno, aun mas el Relojero y Tick-tock, que parece que fueran fantasmas, la OSS es la organización malvada que quiere destruir el tiempo, pero no es un propósito tan villanesco, Cecil y Rebecca son los principales aparte de Marissa y Wilbur, Argonauta es un robot perro creado por la OSS, pensaba que Argonauta, al ser creado por la OSS iba a ser de los malos, pero resulto que era bueno, una película buena y decente, pero se las recomiendo.

This entire franchise is "wasted potential" rolled into one physical collection of willingly distributed immature films with a low target audience. In theory, the concept of juveniles being able to opt-in with government operations and succeed, especially doing much better than the adults WHO ARE ALSO SPIES do. But this franchise, really failed at that. If it didn't, there would be a universe where hearing "Spy Kids" rings as much of a bell as "The Matrix"; this is not that universe. The concept is well done but the execution and logistics to support it are beyond impure. Nothing seems to make sense here, almost as though the screenplays that were chosen by Robert were objectively the worst ones. Time is incredibly inconsistent, as well as making no sense. They practically didn't care for how it would work, even though time travel is a well-known complex of ideas that people haven't quite solved yet, like the unified field theory. The franchise went on for 8 years without a fourth film, exactly the same mediocrity as the previous installations, despite the concept. Hey, the film even acknowledges that adults overthink, and that's certainly true or humans wouldn't be in such a sociological mess that it can't even recognise, even if it's right in front of them.
I was very impressed with how much this was like the OG Spy Kids movies it still retained the charm and style I loved it.

Watching this movie was a good time (Pun Intended), other than the fact that way too many times "time" is said and there is an abuse of fart jokes, the movie accomplished what it should be : enjoyable film aimed to the younger audiences. The movie is a kids movie and many  people just didn't take this right. They evolved, but the series didn't. Maybe they wanted a more teenage aimed movie, or a continuation of the original Spy Kids adventures, this is not. The movie it's a good sequel, I have to say not good enough to sparkle a new trilogy. The new kids are not as interesting as the original were, but the themes the movie touches and how they are implemented in a kids movie is great, important themes such as forgiveness, working together and appreciating each moment, each time. Also when people say there are not strong women in movies, show them this. A spy woman who kicks ass while pregnant and while protecting her baby. Progressive stuff such as inverting the stereotype colors of pink and blue. Rodriguez ability to make movies with a low budget, but with heart and creativity is to be admire.

We need more gimmick movies, I heard this one had a scratch and smell thing going on. Push the medium! Don't be afraid to be creative Hollywood!
Predictable and silly, yet the kids look like they are having fun.
Extremely awful film don’t see it
I love him very much because he was a big part of my childhood.

Decent watch at best, probably won't watch again, and can only recommend for younger audiences.

Well, they definitely managed to get weirder by using time dilation and time travel, it's the worst.  Time travel is way too deep a concept to do properly in children's entertainment, but, that said, they did a decent job of dumbing it down so maybe some of the kids could grasp it.

Again, it weird to see big celebrities come in when I don't think kids would appreciate it, especially Jeremy Piven, who I know is hard to get signed onto a movie.

Again, they spent a lot of time on weird effects or yada-yadaing through a sequence instead of concentrating on a movie of substance.

Admittedly the deliveries were pretty good, and the script was alright, despite including time travel, but with all the time spent on the dog, and avoiding action or spending too little time building a scene, the movie evens out with there being less interesting things that good.

I think kids will get into, and find a lot of the movie, especially that poor dog, hilarious.
Incredibly super terrible sequel, and the worst in the series. Has very stupid humor, horrible acting, bad CGI, and a story that failed badly. One of the worst I've ever seen.
One of the worst films ever.
This movie shouldn't have even been made. The kid actors are horrible. I only liked the cameos from the original cast and that is about all.

There were aspects about this movie and the concept of time that I enjoyed, however this movie was doomed from the overhyped advertising on day one. First of all it is nothing like the original and the original spy kids get barely any screen time which is opposite of what we wanted. We left with characters and a storyline we didn't really care about to be the fourth in the series. Also they advertise the 4d like it was the great experience, it wasn't even 3d and you were given a scratch and sniff card that smelled of chocolate pudding.
Even though I liked this as a kid, this movie is now unfunny and has a boring plot and lots of time jokes.

Good thing this was a soft reboot, or I'd have to deal with the burden of watching the other three movies which I have no real interest in watching anytime soon. While the 4D gimmick and scratch-n-sniff cards did try to allow for a different cinematic experience and has a decent plot twist near the climax, All The Time In The World definitely suggests that Robert Rodriguez's family-friendly franchise was becoming old hat...not that that stopped a Netflix series from getting made years later. The acting is bad, the humour is bad, the plot is generic and the action sequences are so cheesy, they're embarassing to watch. If you ask me, I think that sticking with the Robert Rodriguez's R-rated films like Sin City is the best course of action if you're above the age of 12.
Not as nostalgic as the other 3 but not terrible
I just realized that this franchise is weirdly connected to another Robert Rodriguez franchise, Machete...that is suprisingly awesome
The movie has some improved visuals, but that's it.

TERRIBLE movie.... Just TERRIBLE. The first two Spy Kids movies were excellent, the third one was....SORT OF OKAY, but THIS one was just plain TERRIBLE. The plot is ridiculous and thin. The villains are beyond cheesy. All of the gags fall flat. The humor is completely unfunny. There's even stupid dog shit (literally) humor and it's not even amusing at all. The special/visual effects are god-awful. Most of the acting is bad. The cast is AWFUL (except for Alexa Vega, Darryl Sabara, and Danny Trejo). The only redeeming qualities about this sequel are Alexa Vega and Darryl Sabara back as Carmen and Juni Cortez and Danny Trejo back as Uncle Machete. They're in the movie just for fan service and bait for fans of the previous Spy Kids films and they're added in this movie to tie it in to the other Spy Kids films.

Rating: 2.2/10
For all of humanity, its over, just let it go.
Not good It’s totally different
best movie ever and if u disagree u can fight me in my minecraft world >:(
Energetic and often taking itself way too seriously, the newest Spy Kids has plenty of gross-out humor and wacky gimmicks to keep kids entertained.
What the actual f@#k was this s##t f@#king c@#k sucking piece of s##t going for.
This movie was a waste of time... heh heh, get it?

No amount of Jeremy Piven or a wise-cracking robot dog voiced by Ricky Gervais can even begin to save this unnecessary time pun, potty humor laden fourth installment in a franchise that should have died after the second one.

Best best best
Best best best

We have a problem com on where are the original actors and actresses because this one was not good. I could just not see this movie any more. And why must they make another spy kids I think they should just end with 3 and no more

Spy Kids: All the Time in the World(2011)
Starring:Jessica Alba,Joel McHale,Jeremy Piven,Alexa Vega,Daryl Sabara,and Simon Pegg
Directed By:Robert Rodriguez
Review
And to think I use to enjoy these pieces of crap when I was a kid. When I was little I was having fun with the Spy Kids sequels,Lost dreams and Game over 3D. But I watched them again and had a second opinion thinking that they were stupid. This sequel makes them look like the godfather.
In the most recent Spy kids movie Jessica Alba is playing a spy who has character name that I really don't remember or care about,who has her last mission catches the bad guy has a baby. Year after that some time keeper villain or whatever the heck his name was,makes time go faster and wants to go back in time to spend more time with his father.Jessica Alba recruits her kids and they must take some diamond and stop the Armageddon device and the time keeper.
What immediately ticked me off about this movie is all the marvel references like for example , there is a chase scene in the beginning where the kids are in some CGI spacecraft and there being chased by the time keepers henchmen and it looks like there on the green goblins glider. But wait the references don't stop there,they also have a fight sequence going on and one of the kids have some hammer hands and guess what he says "it's hammer time" and then he lifts one of his hands and lightning is surging through it. That's when I lost it.
The movie of course even brings back the original spy kids,but here's a problem with that,they do the cliche of he/she is dead but they come back for the finale of the film for fan service although I doubt this series has fans and with this movie they lost them.
Spy Kids all the time in the world is one of those family movies that make me hate live action family movies while the sequels before this were bad this is the worst. I give Spy Kids:All the Time in the World a half out of five.
Not well reviewed but my kids enjoyed it. I hated "The Office" but quite enjoyed hearing the voice of Ricky Gervais as the dog.
Not for me, cool seeing original Spy Kids though. Maybe kids will enjoy this, but for older audience members it might be a drag.
It may not be as fun or entertaining as the first two, but it is an entertaining despite having a bad plot, but sometimes a movie needs a good plot to be saved, this is one of those times.

The trilogy barely ended on a decent note, but Rodriguez somehow thought it necessary to tack on a fourth movie, which is as bad as it is unnecessary. However, if the movie was an action comedy with only Joel McHale and no kids clowning up the screen, the movie would have been five stars.
A lame retread of the charming original Spy Kids.
I can't watch my favorite movies
It is an amaizing movie

Robert Rodriguez's immature imagination and sense of humur is on over load. The first 2 are easily the best. The jokes in this one are way too juvenile. Rodriguez's last couple of movies are as if he's not even trying to make a good movie. He's just releasing what goes on in that weird mind of his.

The predictability is high, the little bit of realism is completely out the window, but this part was made for Jessica Alba. She does it very well. So well that all of her scenes help save the film. Having the original spy kids in the film is great, except their roles because just as silly without any real character growth or storyline as to why they are even in the film together. There are just lines so badly that the actors and actresses can not begin to pull them off.
The sniff thing didn't really work. I don't know why but this just wasn't as good as the others.

Other people: Their will never be a film as bad as spy kids 3d game over! 
Me: I like spy kids 3, but omg this is worse! thank god their not making another one.
Other people: agree

Atrocious garbage, Spy Kids: All the Time in the World in 4D is a poorly made film that's incredibly stupid.  The story follows former spy Marissa Wilson, who comes out of retirement when an old nemesis breaks out of prison with designs on destroying the world, and along the way her step-kids join in the adventure and attempt to prove themselves worthy of being "spy kids."  With the introduction of "Spy Baby," the series goes way past jumping the shark.  Jessica Alba and Ricky Gervais both give embarrassingly bad performances, and the new "spy kids" are remarkably bland.  Additionally, the comedy is extremely lame, and the special effects are terrible.  Borderline unwatchable, Spy Kids: All the Time in the World in 4D is the worst film of the series by far.

Her gas problems are going to take the paint off the house.

Marissa Wilson is a former spy that retired after the birth of her daughter.  She is now a simple house mom with her baby and two step children.  When a sinister villain, The Timekeeper, arrives on their door steps, the step mother springs into action and brings her step children along for bonding purposes.

"This is obviously the panic room."
"Why?"
"Because it's a room and I'm panicking."

Robert Rodriguez, director of The Faculty, Desperado, Sin City, Dusk Till Dawn, Spy Kids 1-3, Machete, Planet Terror, Machete Kills, and Sin City: A Dame to Die For, delivers Spy Kids 4.  The storyline for this picture is disappointing and has little going for it.  The special effects and characters are okay and there are some nice cameos in here.

"Our stepmother is a spy?"
"Impossible.  She's not cool enough."

I added all four of these movies to the Netflix wish list for my daughter and I.  She loves these movies.  She is glued to them from beginning to end.  These are nothing special, and fairly poorly written, but kids love these movies; at least, mine did.

"Is the baby throwing food again?"

Grade: D

This makes this more half baked than the others. Not to mention not many plot events, and visual effects. But it also gives you a good theme which is to enjoy time while it lasts. I was amused by the bad acting, diaper bombs, and lasers. But this is just another fail by Robert Rodreguez.

My favorite parts are the ones with Carmen and Juni in it (Spy Kids Alumni). The rest of the movie was decent........but it wasn't charming and brilliant like the first 3 films. Everything was messed up, the jokes were kind of lame and the repetition of the word "Time" kind of spoils the movie. We may have all the time in the world but you better not waste it on this really unwatchable piece of film. Not really good timing.

For me, it was something you might call ''unexpected''. Kids might be scared 'cause time might speed up and eventually they'll be unable to move. It sound false, but my brother thought of it.

This movie is directed by Robert Rodriguez, who has the weirdest filmography, I have seen. He has film Sin City on IMDb Top 250, then he has films like Sharkboy And Lavagirl and Shorts. Was anybody wanting this film? Who in the world was "I love Spy Kids 1&2 and hate Spy Kids 3D, please make good film for the series Robert"? Why this movie is in 4D? Aroma Scope Card doesn't work. 3D is bad as it is, why you have to stretch more dimensions. I will give 0.5/5, because I thought little dog was funny sometimes and there was the kids from original 3 films. There is only one reason why I watched this. I have Netflix and it was there.

Better than the third movie, but that's not saying a lot. Instead of following Juni and Carmen from the previous films, it follows a new family with Jessica Alba as a former spy who has a kid and retires. Jeff Winger, I mean Joel McHale is her husband and has a reality show to hunt spies but he never finds one. The time keeper is loose and is causing time to fly by. So the kids are sent out to stop him. Along the way, they do meet up with Carmen and Juni which help the film a lot, but there's not much to save this wreck.

The worst of the series by far. Only gets a passing grade due to Jessica Alba and Alexa Vega. The story is lame and moronic; fetuses and babies are put in dangerous situations for a laugh?  Hilarious! The toilet humor was fine - I laughed at a good part of it. There has to be some modicum of believability to bring a connection to the characters. There was none of that here.

So bad!!!!! How can u like this stupid movie?!?!?! The jokes r lame that it literally hurts to listen to them. The action was horrible, and the characters r so annoying! Why did they put a helium voice to the bad guy?!?! I only put a half star because flickster didn't have a choice of 0 stars.

I am disgusted. Just, wow this is bad. Every character is annoying, all the humor is about poop, there is no sense of fun or adventure. 
 This is the Batman and Robin of the franchise.

The story and plot were good. The actors were a different story. They were about as skilled as school play actors. What a load crap. The actors are better off working at McDonalds. They would make wonderful janitors who fold up the tables.

I remember when I first saw this movie a few years ago. I remember thinking: God, I hate America. Spy Kids 4-D is an absolute piece of worthless schlock. I never liked Spy Kids, not even when I was little, but this is the most worthless one yet. There's nothing redeeming about. It's one of those movies that I'm embarrassed I actually watched. Yeah, that's how bad it is. It's a movie that literally makes kids dumber. As the Old Man on Pawn Stars would say: movies like this are what's wrong with the whole damn world. Over in Japan family films are about life and filled with emotional weight, America just pulls family films out of its ass. Geeze, maybe that why (or at least one of the reasons) Asians are so smart. They have a society about culture and at a young age are exposed to thought provoking lessons in film. Good god, to be honest I don't even know why I took the time to write this. Anyone whose serious about film knows it terrible wether they've seen it or not.
love this movie it rocks gooooo spy kids
perfect mst3k material, this easily mockable movie decides to use awful cgi and pitiful villains to get across simple messages that have been told better in other movies
The routine story packed with laugh-free fart jokes, booger jokes, and puke jokes may be a sign that the Spy Kids need to retire.

I loved the Spy Kids series, and seeing the newest edition had come out I wanted to relive some youth. However, I sat through most of the film completely embarrassed for the actors. I feel sorry for Alexa Vega and Darly Sabara, their originals have been totally ruined and cheapened. Old jokes were recycled (and not well) and overly cheesy lines were added that would have made me cringe even as a six year old. 
I'll stick to the originals from now on.
it is the cool movie EVEN!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!.

Construit autour d'un procede foireux impossible a refaire chez soi (l'Aroma-Vision), Spy Kids 4D n'a rien d'autre a proposer qu'un ennuyeux film d'action pour enfants (et non pas familial comme les 2 premiers). Trop long, avec des acteurs sous-utilises comme Joel McHale et un manque de suspense plutot genant, Spy Kids ne semble pourtant pas etre le point final d'une franchise qui empire de films en films.
They need to stop making these now. The third one killed the franchise, but this one does a job of keeping it dead rather than reviving it.

Monday, April 8, 2013

(2011) Spy Kids: All the Time In The World
ADVENTURE/ FAMILY

What "Kick Ass" is for older teens is "Spy Kids" is for younger children.  Over-the-top movie written and directed by Robert Rodriguez.  The silly plot involves "A retired spy(Jessica Alba) is called back into action, and to bond with her new step-children, she invites them along for the adventure to stop the evil Timekeeper from taking over the world."~ imdb.com

Besides Alba, there's plenty of many respected actors/ comedians including Ricky Gervais who does the voice for the family mechanical dog Argonaut who probably did it just for the paycheck, comedian and actor Joel McHale playing the role as the unsuspecting husband Wilbur Wilson who just did it for the paycheck, Jeremy Piven playing more than one role who has played forgettable roles in past.  Young little children should be able to enjoy this more than adults since common sense is not in their children's nature but to us adults- it's a total dud experience.

1 out of 4
I hope Robert Rodriguez never makes another Spy Kids movie. He took something good he had created and then just pissed on it.
Excellent movie!! A film for the whole family!
Just think of your son/daughter screaming in your ear. That's the movie.
The original spy kids was much much better

Considering its awful special FX, the most annoying talking dog imaginable and what seems to be a boring villain - i mean really Tick Tock? I have no clue why but this actually was a very decent movie, almost even a good movie! There are a lot of fun things here. The ongoing rivalry between the kids, the pregnant mother which shifts into the mother running around smashing spies with a kid hugging her front side in a carrier, the complexities of 2 kids getting to appreciate their stepmom, some decent humor, and most of all, the spy stuff. Spy kids always makes you feel like our world is filled with the coolest gadgets ever and this installment in the series pulled that off very well. There were even some very good life messages thrown in.

MINIOR SPOILER ALERT: They do bring back the 2 kids from the original Spy Kids movies. I thought that was going to make it incredibly lame but they did it in a pretty reasonable way.

NOTE: This film came out a few months before Hugo did. I guess there was some sort of bug going around the filmmaking world where clocks are just the coolest things ever. The intro for Game of Thrones which was also released in 2011 a few months before this film is also very reminiscent of clocks.

Other random thoughts: the dog actually grew on me as the film progressed. That sort of character is hard to do right and most films absolutely blow it but this one did it right. The child acting was pretty decent as well. The film has superb pacing and the length is also perfect.

ON THE WHOLE: If you are into this general genre, this installment definitely satisfies. I was extremely upset with the 3rd Spy kids film (the one inside of the video game) so I am super happy to see the series back in business.

DO YOU HAVE TO SEE THE OTHER MOVIES TO APPRECIATE THIS ONE? Not really. You should probably see the first one but as I said before, the 3rd one was extremely weak and you can skip right past that one and watch this one without experiencing any plot gaps between films.

Robert Rodriguez's comeback to his kid-friendly franchise has become the most creative and tributing film since Grindhouse and The Faculty. Since Carmen and Juni from the last three movies have grown up the story now focuses on a family of new spies, the leader being the mother this time played by Jessica Alba whereas the leader was the father in the last three movies, ok you get the point. Anyway she has two step kids who are endangered so therefore, they hide in their mum's hideout and find out she's a spy and later they both become the new spy kids with a villain being some guy who steals all the time in the world so that he can go back home to his dad as a child which he knows is impossible but he somewhat won't listen. Carmen and Juni also return as adults now and of course there's that 4D Aroma-Scope inspired by the 1981 film Polyester. Over the years, Rodriguez has seemed to get better and better with his old tribues and creativity and this movie proves it all. Spy Kids 4D: All The Time In The World gets a 9/10.

Terrible sequel and a terrible time at the movies. The new cast sucks, the jokes are awful, the dialogue is bland, poorly written, and stupid, the cgi and visuals are lazily put together and all the fights all look digitally enhanced, and the directing and writing ooze laziness and terribleness (yes I made that word up). Just like the last film, nothing but a cash grab and failed one too because this movie didn't even make half as much money as the other Spy Kids films did. Even Alexa Vega and Daryl Sabara reprising their original Spy Kids roles wasn't even satisfying at all because they became bland and they showed their abilities to not act very well anymore. I will give the film one star because I did think that Ricky Gervais as the dog was a little funny and he had fun voicing it. Now I get to say I am finally done watching this franchise, they were things to enjoy about the first two films, but as 3 and 4 were made the franchise really started to show its lack of new ideas and laziness and Robert Rodriguez ended his franchise with a dud.

Well it's been a little over a month and a half (including a vacation hiatus) and we've reached the end of the Quentin Tarantino/Robert Rodriguez Expletive Dleted project. It's been a hell of a ride. We're ending this with Robert Rodriguez' return to the Spy Kid franchise.

What I love about Robert Rodriguez when it comes to kiddie movies is that he really does have a Peter Pan complex himself. He's a Toys R Us kid who doesn't wanna grow up. He may not be able to nail the appeals-to-the-adults aspect that makes the best kid flicks, but he's got the juvenile mentality down pretty \m/ well. 

Spy Kids 4 checks in with our original kids and introduces a new spy family. The details of the story are incredibly cheesey and implausible, but the fun vibe is still there. New gadets, new spies, new baddies. Besides bringing back Alexa Vega and Darryl Sabarra, we're adding in Jessica Alba, Joel McHale, and Jeremy Piven. If you can overlook the glaring plotholes and dumb dialogue, it's a great ride. It just takes a lot of effort and the proper mindset to do so.

So yeah, I'd have liked to end this project on a better note, but you can't win 'em all. We've got Django Unchained to look forward to later this year from Tarantino and Rodriguez' Machete Kills shouldnt be too far behind. I'm already scheming my next project, so look for that in October. Until then, I'll just be spending all my time at the movie theater. Yay!

When the first Spy Kids movie came out I went mental. I touted it as one of the best movies of the year... that was 11 years ago, man do I feel old now! Other than a ripper horror movie, nothing excites me more than a quality kids flick. I was also a fan of Spy Kids 2 but the series ran out of puff with part 3. It wasn't very good... and now 6 years later Robert Rodriguz returns to the OSS (Office Of Strategic Services) with an all new adventure with a new kids. This movie is a fresh and welcome return to the quality of the original movie. The two new kids are great and Jessica Alba has a lot of fun as their Spy-Mum. The two kids from the original trilogy return as adult spies which continutes the cannon nicely. The juvenile laughs are littered throughout the movie with stupid and zany gadets galore, loads of toilet gags and a great cartoony villain played by Jeremy Piven. Most amusing was Ricky Gervais providing the voice of an animatronic spy-dog (in typical Gervais style). Rodriguz is a movie-making machine... he does it all... and I love that he balances adults movies with kids flicks (Desperado, Sin City, From Dust Till Dawn.... VS.... Spy Kids, Shorts and Shark Boy & Lava Girl)... and he practically makes them all on his own. Spy Kids 4 is great stuff. If you've got kids then check it out... and if you don't have kids then so what? See it anyway. My only dissapointment was that Machete's character (Danny Trejo) only appeared for a split second. Damn!!
The girls enjoyed it.

The 4th Spy Kids installment came unexpectedly, and with moderate commercial success. The Cortez family from the previous movies has been pushed aside for a new cast of actors in a new spy family, the Cortez-Wilsons. The original kids Carmen and Juni do appear in this installment, but act as supporting characters for the new cast. Even their potential to trigger nostalgia for older Spy Kids fans, who watched the originals when they were young enough to enjoy them (like me), isn't enough to save the weak jokes and nonsensical plot here.

The storyline in Spy Kid 4 is disjointed and unoriginal, and ultimately, makes absolutely no sense. The screenwriters probably spent little time attempting to develop a somewhat cohesive plot to follow. The acting is wooden and stiff, as is the misplaced dialogue. The weak attempts at humor are depressing, and, at times, cringe-inducing.

The first two Spy Kids films were far from perfect, but at least the absurd ideas made for funny results and repeated viewings. When you're making ridiculous fantasy spy films for a young audience, you need to be creative and take some risks. Things like the Thumb-Thumbs, fantastical creatures on the Lost Island, and a four-headed David Shaloub made the original films entertaining.

The simple charm and connection between family members also made the originals work. How they interact, argue as families do, and ultimately band together to save the day was fun to see. But any hint of those feelings in this installment is lost by the lack of effort by all involved with 4. I tried, but failed, to find a single good thing in this movie. If you want a simple adventure spy movie for the whole family, maybe not the best one, but at something with a sense of fun and creativity, then stick with the first two Spy Kids, because this is just sad and unnecessary.

1/5

Spy kids 1 great, I loved it and still do, Spy Kids 2 the same, loved it and still do, Spy Kids 3, meh it's ok I don't like it as much now as what I done then it was to busy focusing on 3D gimmicks. Spy Kids 4 All the Time in the World is just wow it is the worst thing I have ever seen in my life, it should have just ended with Game Over. But what's bad about it? is it the fact that you have to keep a look out for a number on screen so you can scratch your scratch and sniff card which makes you feel really stupid? the fact that you wear 3D glasses to? It makes you look like a total Bafoon, I mean do you really need a scratch and sniff to feel like your actually there CAUSE WHEN I WALK AROUND THE STREET I DON'T NEED TO RUB A SCRATCH AND SNIFF TO SMELL A FLOWER I'M PASSING.It dosn't feel like a Spy Kids movie and one of the main reasons for me is because the main characters aren't Karmen and Juni, yes they appear in it older which is kind of cool but when I think Spy Kids I think of them, why? BECAUSE THEY'RE THE MAIN CHARACTERS IN THE OTHER MOVIE'S. Now had they always changed the actors maybe I wouldn't complain as much but I think the main reason is these new kids aren't memorable what so ever, I can't even remember there names to be honest.Then there's the CGI again, oh my goodness they over use CGI in this film so much, it's like Game Over all over again, except in Game Over it's kind of understandable because the creators want to make everything look like the characters are in a game, but with this film it's real life and the effects look cheap and stupid.There are some funny moments but these moments are very rare and I mean very very very very rare. I could talk about this forever but let me rap it up saying that this film is OK for kids 3-7 maybe but for fans of the Spy Kids series don't bother wasting your TIME on this rubbish film.... ALSO WHY ARE THERE SO MANY BAD TIME PUNS!!!!

The Spy Kids films are some of my favorite guilty pleasures, and I find they often have material for both kids and adults to enjoy. Itâ(TM)s no surprise that this flick was so high on my list of most anticipated films of 2011, and even with the first trailer premiere I was still hopeful. Gone is the magic of the first three films, centering on a completely different family and only occasionally dropping hints about the rest of the franchise. This movie fails because the characters we have grown to love over the years, Carmen and Juny, are in the movie for all of about ten minutes. The new kids (and cast) just really donâ(TM)t have what it takes, nor does the incredibly terrible script littered with plot holes.
Just as cartoonishly unrealistic as the first three, but without the epic awesomeness of Antonio Banderas & Carla Gugino. But it does have a grown up, and super sexy, Alexa Vega.

Disappointing. Rodriguez can make really good movies but this one is pretty routine pandering to an undemanding child audience. A good movie for kids doesn't pander and thus succeeds better at entertaining kids and adults. The cast is wasted on this movie. 

Jessica Alba in her black spy outfit looks great, though, and I kind of wish she had been cast as either Natasha Romanov or Selina Kyle in the Avengers or Batman movies respectively. She doesn't embarrass herself in this sub-par film and I've been impressed with her growth as an actress the last few years. I think she could have pulled off either role and looked amazing doing it.

Spy Kids: All the Time in the World is a remarkable film. And not because it's particularly any good. It's a remarkable film because it makes Spy Kids 3D: Game Over look like Citizen Kane. It makes the worst film in the Spy Kids series be the second worst film in the Spy Kids series. That's how completely awful All the Time in the World is.

So the very first scene has Jeremy Piven getting chased by a nine month pregnant Jessica Alba....NINE MONTHS. There is no possible way that a spy agency would ever allow a NINE MONTH PREGNANT WOMAN into the field to do a job. There's NO WAY. Ever heard of a little thing called MATERNITY LEAVE? Oh wait, it's a kids movie and she's doing a bit that's funny to kids, right... But just because it's a kids movie does not mean that the humor has to be stupid. In fact kids should be offended by how dumb the humor is. That opening scene alone is entirely indicative of how utterly offensive this movie is.

The gaps in common sense and logic are abundant to the point of absurdity. The people in this movie are so stupid, it's any wonder they all haven't died already from sheer unconscionable stupidity. And while we're on the subject of death, the new Spy Kids are without a doubt some of the most obnoxious children I've ever seen in a movie (the girl especially). I kept hoping that they'd both horribly die at some point, but alas that was just wishful thinking on my part. I kept hoping and praying that they'd suffer and die from some horribly gruesome and sadistic series of Saw-like traps. Too bad that never happened...but a guy can dream can't he?

Not only are they supremely obnoxious and irritating as characters, but they're also some of the worst child actors I've ever seen. Should I cut them some slack? Not at all. Just because they're kids does not excuse them from being atrocious actors. Want good child actors? See Natalie Portman in Leon: The Professional, Saoirse Ronan in Atonement or Chloe Grace Moretz in  500 Days of Summer or Kick-Ass. Even the original Spy Kids Daryl Sabara and Alexa Vega were better in their first movie than these kids.

Sadly, the adult actors don't really fare that much better. Jessica Alba still looks great as always, even when delivering some of worst lines of dialogue this side of the stratosphere. It makes me die on the inside to see Joel McHale in this movie. JEFF WHAT ARE YOU DOING IN THIS MOVIE? YOU ARE JEFF WINGER FROM COMMUNITY! YOU BELONG AT GREENDALE. YOU ARE WITTY SARCASTIC JEFF, NOT AWKWARD AND UNFUNNY DAD WILBUR WILSON. GET THAT. Jeremy Piven I liked you so much better when you were Ari Gold in Entourage. And Ricky Gervais as the attack dog? No...just...no...

Now I'll admit that I liked that Robert Rodriguez brought back the original Spy Kids for the film, if only to remind me of how much better the first and to a lesser extent the second and third films are to this utter abysmal abomination of a fourth movie. Those were the days...

And I'm sure I'd be remisced if I neglected to mention some of the completely revolting puns and lines of dialogue in this movie regarding time. Thing is I love puns. Just not ones that small children who don't know what's good for them can understand. Puns like "Clocked you", "Time's up" or "This time we better stop the Time Keeper from stopping time.." Really? Really? There's a special rung in Hell reserved just for bad movies like this. Thanks for ruining my childhood...

But the biggest offense this movie has to offer is the very fact that it's another film in a long line of garbage that has kept Robert Rodriguez from making the one movie that he actually does need to make which will most certainly save his career: Sin City 2.
So bad that it cannot be described in words. I want the director, cast and crew of this movie to get run over. Repeatedly.
what the hell... it's ridiculous... not even funny...
